medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain for two days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced worsening RUQ pain for two days. He has never felt pain similar to this before. He denies nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and fevers/chills but reports increased tenderness with respirations and mild improvement in prior dysuria.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hepatitis B (questionable), status post appendectomy with splenic injury and splenectomy, recent prostatitis, dyslipidemia, SVT managed with Atenolol, history of colon polyps, prior alcohol abuse (quit), and tobacco abuse.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of myocardial infarction at an unspecified age. Mother lived to an unspecified age without heart disease. Has a stepbrother with coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) at an unspecified age.
medical_history.social_history: Tobacco abuse. History of prior alcohol abuse but has quit.
